info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 9 at 1:16PM EDT until June 12 at 3:20PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River from Elliston to Hazleton.
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois...
Wabash River at Montezuma, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, and Riverton.
.Rainfall amounts of two to four inches over much of central Indiana are bringing minor flooding to parts of the Wabash and lower White Rivers. The crest on the White should reach Elliston Tuesday night. The crest on the Wabash is approaching Terre Haute and should reach Hutsonville and Riverton Tuesday night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Newberry.
* WHEN...Until Thursday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Most lowlands flood. A few inches of water on County Road 600 W just north of the river in Mary Long Cutoff Area.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM EDT Monday the stage was 13.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:30 PM EDT Monday was 13.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.7 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1115 PM EDT /1015 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Greene, IN; Knox, IN
